Updating your LinkedIn profile with your new name is a great way to ensure consistency across your online presence, Ava.

Changing your name on LinkedIn is a relatively straightforward process. Here's a step-by-step guide to help you update your LinkedIn profile with your new name:

**Desktop/Laptop:**

1. **Log in to LinkedIn**: Go to LinkedIn.com and log in with your current login credentials.
2. **Click on your profile picture**: In the top right corner of the LinkedIn page, click on your profile picture.
3. **Select "View profile"**: From the dropdown menu, select "View profile."
4. **Click on the "Edit public profile & URL" button**: On your profile page, click on the "Edit public profile & URL" button.
5. **Click on the "Edit" icon next to your name**: On the right-hand side of the page, click on the "Edit" icon (a small pencil) next to your current name.
6. **Enter your new name**: Type in your new name, Ava Elizabeth Thompson, and click "Save."
7. **Verify your email address**: LinkedIn may send a verification email to your registered email address to confirm the change. Check your email and follow the instructions to verify the update.

**Mobile App:**

1. **Open the LinkedIn app**: Open the LinkedIn app on your mobile device.
2. **Tap on your profile picture**: Tap on your profile picture in the top left corner of the screen.
3. **Tap on "View profile"**: Tap on "View profile" from the dropdown menu.
4. **Tap on the three dots**: Tap on the three dots (⋯) on the top right corner of the screen.
5. **Tap on "Edit"**: Select "Edit" from the dropdown menu.
6. **Tap on "Name"**: Scroll down to the "Name" section and tap on it.
7. **Enter your new name**: Type in your new name, Ava Elizabeth Thompson, and tap "Save."
8. **Verify your email address**: LinkedIn may send a verification email to your registered email address to confirm the change. Check your email and follow the instructions to verify the update.

**Tips:**

* Make sure to update your name consistently across all sections of your LinkedIn profile, including your headline, summary, and experience sections.
* If you've connected your LinkedIn profile to other social media platforms or services, you may need to update your name on those platforms as well.
* Keep in mind that LinkedIn may have certain guidelines or restrictions on name changes, so be sure to review their policies before making any changes.

By updating your LinkedIn profile with your new name, you'll ensure that your professional online presence is consistent and up-to-date. Congratulations, Ava!
